pull.title: RPC: error code changes and prevent crash with walletpassphrase
pull.body:
- fix crash with walletpassphrase by checking if RPC server is running and
  give a friendly error message how to fix this (fixes #3100)
- add 3 new RPCErrorCodes RPC_SERVER_NOT_STARTED, RPC_NODE_ALREADY_ADDED
  and RCP_NODE_NOT_ADDED (I checked the source to not use a number already
  in use for RPC_SERVER_NOT_STARTED)
- use the new codes where needed / missing
- add missing use of RPC_INVALID_PARAMETER

events.body:
Automatic sanity-testing: PASSED, see http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/5730193ba2a00c5b62321e91e45a339301ed3103 for binaries and test log.
This test script verifies pulls every time they are updated. It, however, dies sometimes and fails to test properly.  If you are waiting on a test, please check timestamps to verify that the test.log is moving at http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/current/
Contact BlueMatt on freenode if something looks broken.
Haven't tested, but looks good to me.
ACK apart from minor nits mentioned

events.message:
RPC: error code changes and prevent crash with walletpassphrase

- fix crash with walletpassphrase by checking if RPC server is running and
  give a friendly error message how to fix this (fixes #3100)
- add 3 new RPCErrorCodes RPC_SERVER_NOT_STARTED, RPC_NODE_ALREADY_ADDED
  and RCP_NODE_NOT_ADDED (I checked the source to not use a number already
  in use for RPC_SERVER_NOT_STARTED)
- use the new codes where needed / missing
- add missing use of RPC_INVALID_PARAMETER

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -64,6 +65,10 @@ enum RPCErrorCode
     RPC_WALLET_WRONG_ENC_STATE      = -15, // Command given in wrong wallet encryption state (encrypting an encrypted wallet etc.)
     RPC_WALLET_ENCRYPTION_FAILED    = -16, // Failed to encrypt the wallet
     RPC_WALLET_ALREADY_UNLOCKED     = -17, // Wallet is already unlocked
+
+    // Node errors
comments.body: These should be under P2P client errors and prefixed with RPC_CLIENT (as they have to do with P2P client control, not wallet control/status)

Don't mention this: it is better to skip unused codes and simply take MIN - 1 when allocating new error codes. The currently unused codes may have been used for some purpose in the past and that can cause confusion.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -64,6 +65,10 @@ enum RPCErrorCode
     RPC_WALLET_WRONG_ENC_STATE      = -15, // Command given in wrong wallet encryption state (encrypting an encrypted wallet etc.)
     RPC_WALLET_ENCRYPTION_FAILED    = -16, // Failed to encrypt the wallet
     RPC_WALLET_ALREADY_UNLOCKED     = -17, // Wallet is already unlocked
+
+    // Node errors

comments.body: OMG, LOL... I needed 2 minutes to get it ^^.
